page.title: 20Tourism in Hayfield
page.content: In our square Hayfield is the most important tourist attraction.In Hayfield there is a picnic area and information office.There is a hotel called The Royal Hotel.It is owned by, Bob Hadfield.There are about twelve shops in Hayfield.In the village there is a cricket ground and park.Hayfield is on the edge of the National Park. In some places of Hayfield there are cobbles,this shows that Hayfield is an old village.Also in Hayfield there is a bus station.This bus station is the start of the Sett Valley Trail.At the start of the trail there is a cycle hire place.The trail has lots of good views and is supposed to be good for cycling along.The Sett Valley Trail starts at Hayfield and finishes at New Mills.The trail is about two and a half miles long and takes about one and a half hours to walk along.
